title: Thalía
summary: Ariadna Thalía Sodi Miranda Mottola (Spanish pronunciation: [aˈɾjaðna taˈli.a ˈsoði miˈɾanda]; born 26 August 1971), known mononymously as Thalía, is a Mexican singer and actress.[1] She is considered one of the most successful and influential Mexican artists[2][3][4] and is referred to as the "Queen of Latin Pop" by international media.[5] Having sold around 25 million records worldwide, she is one of the best-selling Latin music artists of all-time.[6] Aside from her native Spanish, Thalía has also sung in English, French, Portuguese and Tagalog.[7]
